results.byline: By Michael Barbaro, Rob Szypko, Carlos Prieto, Mary Wilson, Stella Tan, Marc Georges, Mike Benoist, Dan Powell, Marion Lozano and Chris Wood
results.title: The Most Empty Downtown in America
results.abstract: San Francisco has been held up as an economic success story, but the heart of the city is yet to recover from the pandemic.

results.adx_keywords: Missiles and Missile Defense Systems;Nuclear Weapons;Nuclear Tests;Defense and Military Forces;Politics and Government;Kim Jong-un;North Korea
results.title: North Korea Urges ‘Preparedness for War’ and Displays New Missile
results.abstract: Analysts said the new weapon was probably a solid-fuel ICBM, which the North’s leader, Kim Jong-un, has wanted to add to his country’s growing nuclear arsenal.

media.caption: A photograph provided by North Korean state media showed an intercontinental ballistic missile during a military parade celebrating the 75th anniversary of the North Korean army in Pyongyang on Wednesday.
media.copyright: Korean Central News Agency, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Music;Pop and Rock Music;Bacharach, Burt;David, Hal;Warwick, Dionne;Costello, Elvis
results.title: Burt Bacharach, Composer Who Added a High Gloss to the ’60s, Dies at 94
results.abstract: His sophisticated collaborations with the lyricist Hal David — “The Look of Love,” “Walk On By,” “Alfie” and many more hits — evoked a sleek era of airy romance.

media.caption: Burt Bacharach in 1965. His effervescent compositions defined sophisticated hedonism for a generation of young people amid the tumult of the 1960s.

results.adx_keywords: News and News Media;Television;Lambert, Evan (Journalist);DeWine, Mike;NewsNation;East Palestine (Ohio)
results.title: Reporter Arrested While Covering News Conference in Ohio
results.abstract: The reporter was arrested after officers said he was being too loud while the Ohio governor spoke about a train derailment in the state.

media.caption: Gov. Mike DeWine of Ohio during a news conference at a school gymnasium in East Palestine on Monday. Evan Lambert, a reporter for NewsNation, was arrested in the same gym during a news conference two days later.

results.adx_keywords: Income Tax;Rebates and Refunds;Tax Preparers and Preparation;Internal Revenue Service
results.title: I.R.S. Tells Millions Who Received State Rebates: Don’t File Just Yet
results.abstract: Tax season is underway. But the Internal Revenue Service is still figuring out whether taxpayers who received rebates last year should count them as taxable income.

media.caption: The Internal Revenue Service is determining which special payments that states made to residents last year should be taxed.
media.copyright: Stefani Reynolds for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Robberies and Thefts;Dogs;Breeding of Animals;Ray, Lonnie A (d 2023);Bishopville (SC);Lee County (SC)
results.title: South Carolina Dog Breeder Is Fatally Shot at Planned Sale of French Bulldog
results.abstract: The attackers also stole the puppy, the authorities said. French bulldogs have become among the most expensive dog breeds in the United States.

media.caption: Lonnie A. Ray was killed on Monday night as he planned to sell a French bulldog for $2,500.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;DNA (Deoxyribonucleic Acid);Forensic Science;Mitchell, Laurel Jean (d 1975);Bandy, Fred  Jr;Lehman, John Wayne;North Webster (Ind);Indiana
results.title: 2 Charged With Murder in 1975 Killing of an Indiana Teenager
results.abstract: Laurel Jean Mitchell was found dead after she left a church camp to meet with friends and never made it. Her case had remained unsolved until DNA testing revealed a match.

media.caption: Laurel Jean Mitchell was 17 when she was found dead in August 1975. The Indiana State Police arrested two men and charged them with murder, after DNA evidence bolstered witnesses’ accounts.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;United States International Relations;Balloons (Aeronautics);Espionage and Intelligence Services;Communist Party of China;China
results.title: House Votes Unanimously to Condemn China Over Spy Balloon
results.abstract: The vote came after Republican leaders rebuffed a right-wing effort to formally rebuke President Biden for the episode, part of an effort to keep partisanship out of China policy.

media.caption: In a photograph provided by the U.S. Navy, sailors recovered parts of the surveillance balloon off the coast of Myrtle Beach, S.C., on Sunday.
media.copyright: Petty Officer 1st Class Tyler Thompson/U.S. Navy, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.byline: By Edward Wong and Julian E. Barnes
results.title: Chinese Balloon Had Tools to Collect Electronic Communications, U.S. Says
results.abstract: China’s surveillance balloons have flown over more than 40 countries and are directed by the Chinese military, the State Department said. The F.B.I. is studying debris.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: This picture provided by the U.S. Navy shows sailors recovering a Chinese high-altitude surveillance balloon off the coast of South Carolina.

results.title: How Can I Convince My Wife That She Cheated Her Siblings?
results.abstract: While dividing up her late mother’s belongings, a woman claimed an extremely valuable artwork for herself, purposely hiding its worth from her fellow heirs.

results.title: Searching for Streaming Profit, Disney Cuts $5.5 Billion in Costs
results.abstract: In the company’s first earnings report since Bob Iger returned as C.E.O., it exceeded Wall Street’s expectations. But about 7,000 jobs are expected to be cut.

media.caption: Robert A. Iger, Disney’s chief executive, in December. On Wednesday, he announced a restructuring that will consolidate production and distribution, with the exception of sports.

results.adx_keywords: Education (K-12);School Discipline (Students);Special Education;Disabilities;Civil Rights and Liberties;Discrimination;United States Politics and Government;internal-storyline-no;Education Department (US);Justice Department
results.title: How Educators Secretly Remove Students With Disabilities From School
results.abstract: Known as informal removals, the tactics are “off-the-book” suspensions often in violation of federal civil rights protections for those with disabilities.

media.caption: Dakotah LaVigne’s tumultuous educational journey has been marked by a series of tactics, known as informal removals, that schools secretly use to remove challenging students with disabilities from class.
media.copyright: Ricardo Nagaoka for The New York Times

results.title: In ‘You’ Season 4, Joe Goldberg Is No Longer in Control
results.abstract: The Netflix thriller’s latest episodes have its antihero, played by Penn Badgley, on the back foot as he navigates the world of London’s ultrarich.

media.caption: In Season 4 of “You,” Joe Goldberg, played by Penn Badgley, standing, is a professor at a fictional London university, trying to start over once again.
